tough.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: difficult to do or deal with
tough.translation[0].definitions[0].note: when the going gets tough (the tough get going) informal (=used to say that when a situation becomes difficult, strong people take the necessary action to deal with it)
tough.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The company admitted that it had been a tough year.
Tough decisions will have to be made.
The reporters were asking a lot of tough questions.
It was a tough call (=a difficult decision), but we had to cancel the game because of the weather.
I find his books pretty tough going (=difficult to read).
Gage predicted the president’s proposal would be a tough sell (=something that is difficult to persuade someone about) before Congress. American English
The family has had a tough time of it these last few months.
It’s tough being married to a cop.
Having to stay indoors all day is tough on a kid.
tough.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: physically or emotionally strong and able to deal with difficult situations
tough.translation[0].definitions[1].note: tough cookie/customer informal (=someone who is very determined to do what they want and not what other people want)
tough.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The men who work on the oil rigs are a tough bunch.
He’s as tough as nails – a good man to have on the team.
as tough as nails/as tough as old boots
tough.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: not easily broken or made weaker
tough.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The EU is taking a tough line with the UK over this issue.
My mother was very tough on my sister.
It’s time to get tough with drunk drivers.
tough.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a tough part of a town has a lot of crime or violence
tough.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: likely to behave violently and having no gentle qualities
tough.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: one of football’s most notorious tough guys
tough young thugs looking for trouble
tough.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: The meat was tough and hard to chew.
the tough outer leaves of the cabbage
tough.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: someone who often behaves in a violent way
tough.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: in a way that shows you are very determined
tough.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Washington played tough in the second half of the game.
You’re talking tough now but you wait until you get into the interview.
